Redocs Examples & Showcase

This page demonstrates all the markdown components and features available in Redocs. Use this as a reference for creating your own documentation.

Paragraphs and Emphasis

This is a regular paragraph with bold text and italic text. You can also use bold and italic together.

Here‚Äôs another paragraph with inline code and a link to the features page.

Text Styling Examples

  • Bold text using **text**
  • Italic text using *text*
  • Bold and italic using ***text***
  • Inline code using backticks
  • Strikethrough text using ~~text~~

üìã Lists

Unordered Lists

  • Redocs Features:
    • Markdown to HTML conversion
    • Dynamic navigation
    • Syntax highlighting
    • Responsive design
    • Custom themes

Alternative Bullet Style

  • Another way to create lists
  • Using asterisks instead
  • Works the same way

Ordered Lists

  1. Install Node.js
  2. Clone the repository
  3. Install dependencies
    npm install
  4. Build the documentation
    npm run build
  5. Serve locally
    npm run serve

Nested Lists

  • Main category
    • Subcategory 1
      • Item 1.1
      • Item 1.2
    • Subcategory 2
      • Item 2.1
      • Item 2.2
  • Another main category
    1. Numbered sub-item
    2. Another numbered item

Task Lists

  • [x] Create markdown files
  • [x] Set up build system
  • [ ] Add custom themes
  • [ ] Deploy to production
  • [ ] Write documentation

üíª Code Blocks

JavaScript Example

// Redocs build script example
const fs = require('fs-extra');
const path = require('path');
const md = require('markdown-it')();

function buildDocs() {
  const docsDir = path.join(__dirname, 'docs');
  const files = fs.readdirSync(docsDir);
  
  files.forEach(file => {
    if (file.endsWith('.md')) {
      const content = fs.readFileSync(path.join(docsDir, file));
      const html = md.render(content.toString());
      // Process and save HTML
    }
  });
}

Python Example

# Example Python code
def greet_user(name):
    """Greet a user with a personalized message."""
    return f"Hello, {name}! Welcome to Redocs documentation."
    
# Usage
message = greet_user("Developer")
print(message)

CSS Example

/* Redocs styling example */
.documentation {
  max-width: 1200px;
  margin: 0 auto;
  padding: 2rem;
  font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', sans-serif;
}

.sidebar {
  width: 280px;
  background: #fff;
  border-right: 1px solid #e1e4e8;
  position: fixed;
  height: 100vh;
}

HTML Example

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="UTF-8">
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
  <title>Redocs Documentation</title>
</head>
<body>
  <div class="container">
    <nav class="sidebar">
      <!-- Navigation content -->
    </nav>
    <main class="content">
      <!-- Main content -->
    </main>
  </div>
</body>
</html>

Bash Commands

# Install dependencies
npm install

# Build documentation
npm run build

# Serve locally
npm run serve

# Check file structure
ls -la docs/

Complex Table

Component Syntax Example Renders As
Bold **text** **Bold text** Bold text
Italic *text* *Italic text* Italic text
Code `code` `console.log()` console.log()
Link [text](url) [GitHub](https://github.com/) GitHub

üîß Advanced Features

Definition Lists

Term 1 : Definition 1

Term 2 : Definition 2 : Another definition for term 2

Abbreviations

*[HTML]: HyperText Markup Language *[CSS]: Cascading Style Sheets *[JS]: JavaScript

The HTML, CSS, and JS are used for web development.

Footnotes

Here‚Äôs a sentence with a footnote[^1].

[^1]: This is the footnote content that appears at the bottom of the page.

Subscript and Superscript

  • H~2~O is water
  • X^2^ is X squared
  • E = mc^2^ (Einstein‚Äôs equation)

Highlighted Text

==This text is highlighted== using the mark syntax.

Inserted Text

++This text is inserted++ using the insert syntax.

üéØ Complete Example

Here‚Äôs a complete example combining multiple components:

API Documentation Example

Note: This example shows how to document an API endpoint.

Authentication

All API requests require authentication via API key in the header:

const headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer your-api-key',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
};

Endpoint: GET /users

Description: Retrieve a list of users

Parameters:

Parameter Type Required Description
page number No Page number (default: 1)
limit number No Items per page (default: 10)
search string No Search term

Example Request:

curl -X GET "https://api.example.com/users?page=1&limit=5" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer your-api-key"

Response Format:

{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "John Doe",
      "email": "john@example.com"
    }
  ],
  "pagination": {
    "page": 1,
    "total": 100,
    "pages": 20
  }
}

Error Handling:

try {
  const response = await fetch('/users');
  const data = await response.json();
} catch (error) {
  console.error('Error:', error.message);
}

This comprehensive example demonstrates all the markdown components and features available in Redocs. Use these patterns to create rich, well-structured documentation!
